p: A comprehensive literature survey was done on the medicinally important herbal flowers in Sri Lanka. The data was obtained from the Libraries of Navinna Ayurveda Hospital, Maharagama, Sri Lanka, and Institute of Indigenous Medicine, University of Colombo, Rajagiriya, Sri Lanka. Books like Medicinal Herbs and Flowers [ 78], The Chemistry and Pharmacology of Ceylon and Indian Medicinal Plants [ 3], Medicinal Plants Used in Ceylon-Part I [ 7], Part II [ 25], Part III [ 24], Part IV [ 27], and Part V [ 51], Sri Lankawe Osu Shaka Saha Ewaye Wadagathkama [ 8], and Medicinal Herbal [ 5] were used. Further research was carried out based on the scientific names collected from the flowering ayurvedic plants from these books using scientific databases PubMed, Google Scholar, and Web of Science. Nine Ayurveda books and 69 journal articles were referred in this article.
